body:
I implemented the bare bones of this [here](https://github.com/jamesmf/doccano/pull/1) but it doesn't have a front-end because I'm not sure the best way to do it with a button (prompt?)

It should probably be tied to the code in AutoLabeling.put too.

If exporting entity annotations in spaCy format is to be supported it would also be useful to be able to export text classifications in a spaCy like format as well such as:

```
("Uber blew through $1 million a week", {'cats': {'BUSINESS': 1.0, 'MONEY': 1.0}}),
("Google rebrands its business apps", {'cats': {'BUSINESS': 1.0, 'MONEY': 0.0}})
```

This section (in load_data()) suggests that the values should be Boolean (don't know if it matters), but I haven't seen an example of multiple categories. From your example I'm assuming we would want to export every label for every document?

Yes based on this example: https://github.com/explosion/spacy/blob/master/examples/training/train_textcat.py it appears that the data should be boolean, even though it is given as a digit in the code examples.  Dumping the training dataset to json looks like this: https://gist.github.com/Zerthick/271ff0f2a36898d58da56e1f81e9d3be

Based on this issue https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/2105 I believe spaCy supports multi-label text categorization and as such I assume one would export all possible labels for each sample, with the labels for that particular sample set to true.

**Edit:**
The exporting of all labels seems to be supported by this issue as well: https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/1562#issuecomment-353593552

**Edit 2:**
If all labels are not exported the model treats the missing labels as unknown leading to different results as illustrated by this issue: https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/1997

Is it fair for this to be impelemented with "format=spacy" passed to the DataDownload endpoint? In the case of SequenceLabeling, it'd download it as the format in the branch I referenced above, and in the TextCategorization it would export {'cats': {'label_1': True, 'label_2': False', ...., 'label_N': False}}. For Sequence to Sequence, it could ignore it.
That would seem logical to me, but we'll have to see what @Hironsan thinks.
Is there any update regarding this? I'd like to use this functionality in an upcoming project 😄 I'd be happy to assist in the dev work in some way if possible.

I haven't worked any more on it because I don't know how it is best implemented on the front end: should the export data button become a dropdown? 

Also I originally was working off `feature/auto_labeling` so my work can't be cleanly PR'd back into `master`. I don't want to go back and tackle the rest of this feature from `master` until I'm sure I understand how/whether I can get things merged back in.
I agree, I think guidance from either @Hironsan or @icoxfog417 is needed before moving forward.

issue.title: Support importing datasets in JSON format

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Currently in order to upload a dataset for annotation all of the documents in the dataset must be in a single txt file with each document separated by a newline character like so:
```
document 1 text
document 2 text
```
It would be very helpful if instead documents could be within separate files and a bulk upload could be performed.  For example:

**Document 1**
```
Document
1
text
```

**Document 2**
```
Document
2
text
```

This would also allow documents to contain newline characters which was requested here: #12 

Love the tool!

issue.title: Adding in linebreaks filters

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
I'm attempting to add in linebreak filters to allow newlines to be rendered within documents to complement #17 however I can't seem to get them working.

I've identified the line which inserts the document text to be line 34 of document_classification.html
https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/blob/master/app/server/templates/annotation/document_classification.html#L34

However modifying it to `[[ docs[pageNumber].text|linebreaks ]]` does not produce the desired effect.

On a side note I am not very familiar with Django, what is the significance of the double square-bracket syntax? I have not seen it in any Django examples.  Aren't variables typically inserted with double curly-brackets in templates?

body: @jamesmf  We are working to implement a download page with two download buttons. The 'export data' in the navigation bar can redirect the user to download page. A user can choose to download CSV file or JSON file by clicking the button.
